title: El Malpais National Monument: Accessibility
body: Accessibility         A hiker treks through rough lava country. NPS Photo  Fully Accessible Facilities  The El Malpais Visitor Center has universal design features: accessible parking spaces, ramped sidewalks and walkways, accessible picnic tables, automatic doors, and accessible restrooms. The theater features captioning for videos and assistive listening equipment.  The El Malpais Information Center features accessible parking, paved walkway, and accessible restrooms.  The BLM Ranger Station features accessible parking, paved walkways, and accessible restrooms.  Activities  Scenic driving will take visitors to good views of many features in the park. The parking areas at Lava Falls on Highway 117 and the Zuni-Acoma Trail on Highway 53 are accessible. Other trailheads have gravel or dirt parking areas and are accessible with assistance. Trails in the area are not accessible due to the extremely rugged nature of the terrain.
